meanings.definition: A person who constantly complains or whines.
meanings.sent1: The group of bellyachers at the meeting never seemed satisfied.
meanings.sent2: My sister is the biggest bellyacher when it comes to doing chores.
meanings.sent3: The bellyachers in the movie theater made everyone laugh with their constant complaints.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was filled with bellyachers, their voices like a chorus of discontent.
meanings.sent5: The image of a bellyacher is someone always grumbling and never content.

meanings.sent1: Stop bellyaching about the weather and just enjoy the day!
meanings.sent2: She bellyaches every time she has to do her homework.
meanings.sent3: The cat bellyached loudly when it didn't get its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The engine bellyached as it struggled to start in the cold morning.
meanings.sent5: The child bellyached about having to eat vegetables, making a fuss at the dinner table.
